docs.snippet: Theodore Roszak is famous for his two earlier books, "The Making of a Counter Culture" and "Where the Wasteland Ends." This is the third and most advanced formulation of his thesis, begun in the 1960's, concerning what he calls "a revolt of people...
docs.lead_paragraph: Theodore Roszak is famous for his two earlier books, "The Making of a Counter Culture" and "Where the Wasteland Ends." This is the third and most advanced formulation of his thesis, begun in the 1960's, concerning what he calls "a revolt of people against massification in behalf of their embattled personhood."

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 8--The Mexican Government, in an effort to curb a growing protest campaign over alleged human rights violations, has announced that a long investigation shows that no persons have "disappeared" in Mexico....

docs.snippet: It's true, as many highly articulate women claimed, that for a number of years movies treated their heroines as second-class citizens--as hookers or virgins, or as larger-than-life sex-objects or as home-makers (when they could have been house-bui...
docs.lead_paragraph: It's true, as many highly articulate women claimed, that for a number of years movies treated their heroines as second-class citizens--as hookers or virgins, or as larger-than-life sex-objects or as home-makers (when they could have been house-builders), always as vacuous supporting characters in the more important dramas of male egos.

docs.snippet: WESTPORT THE decor is contemporary Connecticut, the  menu is New Orleans, and the food itself is, well, somewhere in between. The Carriage House, long a Westport landmark, was out of  business for a year while a new building was under construction...
docs.lead_paragraph: WESTPORT THE decor is contemporary Connecticut, the menu is New Orleans, and the food itself is, well, somewhere in between. The Carriage House, long a Westport landmark, was out of business for a year while a new building was under construction, but it is now back in a handsome new complex called Carriage Hill.
